title: The Central Bank of Uruguay cut interest rates by 100 basis points to 6.5%.
summary: According to our station, the Central Bank of Uruguay announced yesterday that it would cut its benchmark interest rate by 100 basis points to 6.5%, marking the country's first monetary policy adjustment this year. Notably, the central bank also announced a change in its policy meeting schedule to increase decision-making flexibility. This decision comes against the backdrop of a continued strengthening of the Uruguayan peso against the US dollar; data shows the peso has appreciated by 7.2% in the past three months. Analysts point out that this marks the beginning of a new phase in the South American country's monetary easing cycle.
